HERP.content: advisable to decelerate, if one wants to read and think what one claims to judge

MSUBJ.content: “let’s go slowly”; p. 164 “not to rush, seize”

POOF.content: that the decision of a friend should be slow means it's not yet, it isn’t stable, it’s undecidable

for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!

MPM.content: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
Pascal says don’t read too fast or slow—find a rhythm (accelerate toward rhythm)

PAS.content: “I [Derrida]” would like you (tu) to slowly approach viens
Blanchot: when he says viens, she approaches slowly, a slowness most foreign to hesitation, in contrast to brevity of authoritarian invitation
slowness: delays, accelerates, displaces time, keeps (guards) infinite distance of moments
female voice asks: why her? why is this movement entrusted to the figure of she? Derrida responds by saying, we need to learn infinite patience, be immobilized endlessly in each passage
Derrida approaches Blanchot slowly, makes the go and come of Blanchot’s pas resonate, not dominate the text, approach event of his unheard of signature, plunge it back into son eau
Blanchot: “more slowly than any slowness, more suddenly than any surprise”
an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence
if I write slowly you can hear si j’étais là (if/yes I was there) in three ways

FWT.content: deconstruction: slow/progressive approach—not attempting to destroy/discredit axiomatics of this (formal/juridical) solution [re: animal rights] > reconsider history of law/concept of right

POS.content: “I read while writing: slowly, taking pleasure in long prefaces to each term”

WM.content: from philosophy, rhetoric—to make flowers bloom, make them mount themselves, lapidary’s reckoning, patience

DS.content: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)

P.content: if we’re in a hurry, we’ll conclude the colossal is the phallus, which doubles the corpse; Derrida jokes: don’t hurry when it’s a matter of erection, let the thing happen
“we shall come back to it after moving slowly around its [the colossal’s] site”

OTO.content: in the name of an old tradition, Nietzsche tells us to slow down, take all the time to read, at beginning of “On the Future of our Educational…”

GSP.content: “let us pause for a moment at a second border problem”

WAP.content: certains sont toujours impatients d’accéder-directement-aux-choses-mêmes-et-d'atteindre-sans-attendre-tout-droit-le-vrai-contenu-des-problèmes-urgents-et-graves-qui-se-posent-à-tous-etc. > demand not to be slow, self-indulgent, has a history, a hypocritical structure

SW.content: sericulture, culture of silk: the incomparable patience it demands from sericultivator

“not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere

Gii.content: Heidegger: 2 hands clutch in haste, utilitarian violence (want #, quantity), don’t have patience of 1—the essential is not #, it’s the right time (die rechte Zeit)

REST.content: no hasty step here, la précipitation du pas, unavoidable w/ Van Gogh’s shoes? [p. 265 pas de préciptitation]
[slight difference from Bataille, not sliding?] nous piétinons, nous ne patinons même pas, nous pataugeons (floundering) w/ slightly indecent complacency

DST.content: de Man’s “no blind spot (tache aveugle)” in Rousseau made Derrida impatient > but impatience should incite one to take one’s time, impatience is never justified

PSSS.content: Derrida, advancing to a new theater of cruelty, wants to avoid alibis, will be very slow: prefers incorrigibly long [therapy] sessions

TN.content: pause for a moment (pour s’arrêter un instant)

ATM.content: inconsolable slowness of gift, as if necessary to delay the endless falling due (échéance) of repetition

AD.content: Levinas: patient awaiting of God, patience of excess, a waiting where nothing is awaited

EW.content: on the democracy to come, on its safeguarding against the worst: don’t expect a formula from Derrida—but a long, slow trajectory

BSi.content: repoliticization (another politicization not depoliticization), a slow and differentiated deconstruction occurs in the divisibility of sovereignty already happening

OG.content: slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour

UWC.content: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees
take your time, but be quick: don’t know what awaits you
